msContents.summary: A lsi of household items. The purpose of writing down the present list could be the registration of objects which were either part of a dowry or an inheritance or part of pawnbrokers' account.

msItemStruct.note: Under the same no and folder there are a few more pieces of other papyri (unpublished)

condition.ab: A long brown papyrus preserving the ends of some lines of a column follwed by the top of the left part a second column. The lower part of the papyrus has been lost.

layout.ab: recto: col. I, ends of lines; col. II, 17 lines; verso, 3 lines

handDesc.p: The top margin -judging from the second column - is 1.6 cm, the left intercolumnnar margin is 4.6 cm In ll. II, 7 and 12 there is an ethesis and in ll. 6 and 13 an eisthesis. The first denotes the change of the paragraph and the late prevents the reader from consideing ll. 6 and 13 as another entry. Opposite ll. 4, 5, 8, 10, 11, 12, 15 of col. II final strokes of some letters are preserved in col. I. There is a collesis close (ca. 1 cm) to the left edge. The papyrus was turned 180 degress and its back preserves two lines just at the point where the papyrus was broken, which could be regarded as the last two entries of this list. Below just one letter is preserved, which probably points to the beginning of another line written in eisthesis.
